bibl.title: A Triumphant Macedonian Horseman: Evidence of a Ptolemaic Victory Monument.
bibl.note: The type of the victorious Macedonian horseman, which is only preserved in form of terracotta statuettes, is very likely to be a representation of Ptolemy I. It is probably modelled on a victory monument erected in the time following the Syrian campaign of 312/11 B.C.

bibl.title: Patrizia MINÀ (coordinamento e redazione), Faraoni come dei, Tolemei come faraoni. Atti del V Congresso Internazionale Italo-Egiziano, Torino, Archivio di Stato, 8-12 dicembre 2001

bibl.seg: FlSCHER Jutta, A Triumphant Macedonian Horseman: Evidence of a Ptolemaic Victory Monument.

Nicola BONACASA, Anna Maria DONADONI ROVERI, Sergio AIOSA e Patrizia MINÀ (a cura di), Patrizia MINÀ (coordinamento e redazione), Faraoni come dei, Tolemei come faraoni. Atti del V Congresso Internazionale Italo-Egiziano, Torino, Archivio di Stato, 8-12 dicembre 2001 (Torino - Palermo, 2003) pp. 375-380, 1 pl.

The type of the victorious Macedonian horseman, which is only preserved in form of terracotta statuettes, is very likely to be a representation of Ptolemy I. It is probably modelled on a victory monument erected in the time following the Syrian campaign of 312/11 B.C.
